editorialNotes.standard: Tear apart the world to rebuild it in this creative post-apocalyptic survival game with an upgrade system that compels us to explore and experiment.
This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

editorialNotes.standard: Its one thing to say youd never take a bribe: Its quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. Thats but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the seriesand its still astoundingly impressive. Its a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernised battle encounters. As you make your way through the storys twists and turns, youll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.
Intuitive deck building, a sinister game show setting, and snarky quips from a malevolent Lady Luck keep us coming back to roll the dice in this fantastic roguelike.

editorialNotes.standard: The Lifeline series of innovative, interactive text adventures gets creepierand much colderwith Whiteout. The twisting plot in this chilling new chapter is as vivid and captivating as ever, and rash choices can have especially deadly outcomes if you don't weigh your options carefully. Its tense, fast-paced fiction in perfect bite-sized servings.

name: Six Ages: Ride Like the Wind

editorialNotes.short: The ultimate outcome is up to you in this incredible tale of survival.
editorialNotes.standard: The first in a series of groundbreaking text adventures, Lifeline kept us in suspense the whole time, desperately awaiting the next message from marooned astronaut Taylor. As you receive text notifications telling you what Taylors doing, you reply with instructions on which way to travel, whether to explore a derelict ship, and other crucial decisions. The tension mounts as you try to help the castaway survive, and the option to rewind and pick different choices makes the game wonderfully replayable.

editorialNotes.short: Check out a heartfelt retro-style tale that transcends time and space.

editorialNotes.standard: A delight to explore, brimming with surprises ranging from sarcastic vending machines to nightmarish bosses, were still finding new paths, new choices, and unexpected encounters that make us laugh.

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enixs masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

ios.subtitle: A journey along the fault line

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Thanks, space crooks! Because of you, were back in the saddle, enforcing the law in one of our favourite wild-west futures. Like last time, the gorgeous, open-ended levels do a stellar job of rewarding stealthy tactics and in-your-face gunplayyour choice. Whether we snuck or shot our way through enemy hideouts, we had a blast.
editorialNotes.short: Bring the law to the wild frontiers of space.
